body.description: The HP ENVY Inspire 7958e is a premium multi-purpose home printer with everything families need to learn, work, and create. Loaded with features to print high-quality photos, homework, office docs and everything else. Includes the optional HP+ Smart Printing System that keeps itself up to date and ready to print from virtually anywhere at any time—at no additional cost.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Compare HP home and family printers Currently viewing See Details Learn more Add to Cart Learn more Add to Cart Learn more Add to Cart Customer Reviews — 3.9 out of 5 stars 5,628 4.0 out of 5 stars 10,149 4.1 out of 5 stars 22,000 Price — $89.99$89.99 $79.99$79.99 $59.99$59.99 Functions Print, scan, copy, mobile fax Print, scan, copy, mobile fax Print, scan, copy, mobile fax Print, scan, copy, mobile fax Advanced photo features Yes N/A N/A N/A Auto 2-sided printing Yes Yes Yes N/A Auto document feeder 35-sheet 35-sheet N/A 35-sheet Print speed (up to) 15 ppm black, 10 ppm color 10 ppm black, 7 ppm color 10 ppm black, 7 ppm color 8.5 ppm black, 5.5 ppm color Connectivity Self-healing Wi-Fi Self-healing Wi-Fi Self-healing Wi-Fi Dual-band Wi-Fi w/ self-reset Input/output capacity 125 sheets/60 sheets 100 sheets/25 sheets 100 sheets/25 sheets 60 sheets/25 sheets Separate photo tray Yes N/A N/A N/A Borderless printing Yes Yes Yes N/A HP+ eligible Yes, activate at printer setup Yes, activate at printer setup Yes, activate at printer setup Yes, activate at printer setup Instant Ink included 6 months with HP+ 6 months with HP+ 6 months with HP+ 6 months with HP+ HP Smart app Premium features with HP+ Premium features with HP+ Premium features with HP+ Premium features with HP+

What are the benefits of HP+? HP+ is a smart printing system that gives you premium cloud-connected solutions, an extra year of HP coverage, exclusive HP Smart app features, and 6 months optional subscription to the Instant Ink replenishment service. What are the requirements of this HP+ printer? The optional cloud-connected HP+ printing system requires an HP account, ongoing internet connection, and use of Original HP Ink Cartridges for the life of the printer. Does an HP+ printer require a subscription to the Instant Ink service or other ongoing costs? No, there are no additional costs associated with HP+. You can choose to enroll in an optional subscription for Instant Ink and receive 6 months subscription, but it is not required. What is the HP Smart app and why should I use it? HP Smart app is a top-rated app that enables you to set up your printer, print/scan from virtually any device anywhere, and access exclusive HP+ features. The Smart app is required to set up your HP+ printer from a mobile device or your computer. How does HP protect my privacy with a connected, account-based device? Privacy and data protection are extremely important to HP. HP collects certain printer and usage data to improve the printing experience. HP does not access content from any files shared through the cloud or printed on our printers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Printer does not work
reviews.reviewText: Out of the box, wifi setup barely works - cartridge issues, printer had coffee stains on it…and pictures are attempts to print test pages after several reinstalls :) - can confirm, printers still suck.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect For All My Jobs.
reviews.reviewText: It is easy to unload out of the box and easy to assemble. I especially like the two-sided page feature.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars FOR THE LOVE OF GOD BUY A DIFFERENT PRINTER
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRINTER. I run a business. I needed a new printer. I paid over $200 for this printer. What they FAIL to tell you about this printer is if you do not want to subscribe to HP's ink service you cannot use the printer with the ink they sell. We got the free subscription with the printer and as soon as the trial ended I couldn't use the printer unless I paid the subscription. So I kept the subscription for a month after and got the bill and they charged me for printing "too many" invoices because you can only print 100 pages for $6 a month. How are you going to charge people to print the paper THEY PAID FOR on the printer THEY PAID FOR because you want to greedily continue to charge people when they already paid for the product. I decided to cancel the subscription because the whole idea behind it is bogus, but they still sent new ink in the mail because it was reading low before I cancelled the subscription. The subscription cancels, the next day I go to print off invoices, and I have an error message saying I cannot use the brand new ink cartridges they sent me because they're only usable with the subscription and cannot print a single page on MY PRINTER, that I PAID FOR, with the paper I BOUGHT because I choose not to subscribe. Not to mention the plans they have for you to choose from are just absolutely ridiculous. They limit the amount of pages you can print with each plan varying from 10-700 (at $.99/month-$24.99/month). Who the f wants to pay more just to use THEIR PRINTER AS MUCH AS THEY SO CHOOSE TO. So unless you want to pay $50 for each ink cartridge in stores, or pay every month to subscribe and over pay if you actually use your printer, buy something else.Also, it cannot print more than one page at a time on single sheets even with double-sided deselected. You have to print ONE PAGE AT A TIME or rip the first page out before it sucks it back in and starts to print on the back even when you tell it not to.find something else. for the love of god, find a different printer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like the quality of this printer. It is sharp and double-sided printing is very handy. However, it is very slow processing the “commands” so it’s hard to tell if something has printed if you are in another room. I like the WiFi as I usually print from another room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace my old printer that broke. So far it has handled well with the amount of printing I do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought this for our non profit art league

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It was cheap.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace a failed Canon megatank printer, which had a litany of issues. One of them was that the nozzles would be clogged whenever I went to use it. I was looking at laser printers when I came across this unit at a price I couldn't pass up. And since the print heads are part of the ink cartridges, I figured clogged nozzles wouldn't be an issue.I was wrong.I print only intermittently - a couple of times a month or less, though some of those jobs are many pages long. The first month this printer was great. Always ready and prints were acceptable. And then nozzles started clogging. Easy fix - clean them. But that uses ink. Expensive ink. Two months after purchase I had to run a cleaning cycle before every print job. Not acceptable. I just replaced the first set of tanks today, and I'm disappointed to report that even after a printhead alignment (which uses ink) large dark areas are still "bandy". This is NOT a photographic printer, and I didn't expect it to be. But I did expect consistent, even coverage in large areas of color. It does not deliver.The good: Setup was easy. Software automatically finds the printer on each PC, Mac, or phone. It's fairly quiet (in quiet mode) and reasonably fast. The scan/copy functions work as expected.Print quality for text is good. Pages of text with small graphics look great.Auto duplexing (printing on the back side of the paper) was a nice surprise.The bad:It's ugly. Ok, that's subjective, but to me it is. The software package is heavy and it wants each user to register for HP's instant Ink service. Only one user needs to do this. The software works if you don't register, but it would be nice if that was made more clear during the install.The touch screen is not terribly responsive and there is no feedback. The paper tray cover, which is also the output tray, does not easily slide into place.Ink doesn't last long. That's the reason I went with a megatank printer last time. Ink tank life is reduced by the need to clean the nozzles every time I print. Did I mention that ink is expensive?Print quality for pictures is sub par. Dark areas are bandy. It's probably acceptable for a picture embedded in a report, for example. I wouldn't expect to use a printed picture on display in a frame.With moderately frequent use, a couple of times a week or more, this is probably a good printer. If you're like me and sometimes go months between prints, this is not your printer. But then, most likely no inkjet is.One last note, in case HP reads this. The Canon that this printer replaced lasted well over a year before I had nozzle clog issues. This printer didn't make it three months.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy set up
reviews.reviewText: I got a great deal on the printer using my credit card (not Chase). It arrived in a timely manner. Set up was so easy. I love my new printer.
